They have changed the name.  Apparently they do not know Shakespeare ... or do not realize that the opposite of "A rose by any other name ..." is also applicable.

Alexander Godunov, the bad guy of "Die Hard" and a Russian defector(1979), must have died before the final scenes of this movie could be completed so along with the switching planes in the middle of 'dogfights', the overly obvious manakin used as a burning prop, contradictory scenes and incomplete dialogues one gets to watch some other actor complete the film.

Notably the flight scenes at the beginning are all (bad) edits from the Iron Eagle movie which is about the same class movie. People familiar with jets, especially the F-16, will enjoy some parts but do double-takes when the plane switches to another jet(note the lack of vertical fins). The small amount of gratuitous nudity and the strangeness of it(it does not fit) does not help the movie ...perhaps it was shot after the film was completed.

It's a grade C for me, and not one I would want to watch again.  If one truly has nothing else to do, it is tolerable... once.
Okay B movie if you really want to watch something in action genre. Runs out of steam after the opening plane chase. Ho hum plot and cinematography after opening.
I could make a better story line. The acting was not professionally done.
